film)|Maya the Bee Movie]]'' (2014)|''[[Maya the Bee: The Honey Games]]'' (2018)| ''[[Maya the Bee: The Golden Orb]]'' (2020)}} | vgs = {{ubl|''Maya the Bee & Her Friends'' (1999)|''Maya the Bee – Garden Adventures'' (2000)[http://www.keengames.com/products/former/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures.html Neon Studios Maya the Bee] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080323213345/http://www.keengames.com/products/former/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures.html |date=March 23, 2008 }}|''Maya the Bee and Friends'' (2006)[http://www.kiloo.com/brand_game_mayathebee.html Kiloo page] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080419060016/http://www.kiloo.com/brand_game_mayathebee.html |date=April 19, 2008 }}|''Maya the Bee: The Great Adventure'' (2002){{cite web|url=http://shinen.com/games/game.php3?maya |title=Shin'en Maya the Bee |publisher=Shinen.com |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}|''Maya the Bee: Sweet Gold'' (2005){{cite web|url=http://shinen.com/games/game.php3?maya2 |title=Shin'en Maya the Bee 2 |publisher=Shinen.com |date=March 18, 2005 |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}|''The Bee Game'' (2007){{cite web|url=http://www.independent-arts-software.de/index.php?id=39&L=1 |title=tBG GBA page |publisher=Independent-arts-software.de |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.independent-arts-software.de/index.php?id=35&L=1 |title=tBG DS page |publisher=Independent-arts-software.de |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://mayabeegame.com/ |title=Midway the Bee Game page |publisher=Mayabeegame.com |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}|''Maya'' (2013)|''Maya the Bee: The Nutty Race'' (2019)}} }} '''Maya the Bee''' ({{Lang-de|link=no|Die Biene Maja}}) is the main character in '''''The Adventures of Maya the Bee''''', a German book written by [[Waldemar Bonsels]] and published in 1912. The book has been published in many other languages and adapted into different media. The stories revolve around a little [[bee]] named Maya and her friends Willy the bee, Flip the [[grasshopper]] (referred to as "Maja", "Willi" and "Philip" respectively in some versions), Mrs. Cassandra (Maya's teacher), and many other insects and other creatures. The book depicts Maya's development from an adventurous youngster to a responsible adult member of bee society. ==Plot== Bonsels' original book contains fewer than 200 pages. The storyline is centered on the relation of Maya and her many adventures. Maya is a bee born in a bee hive during internal unrest: the hive is dividing itself into two new colonies. Maya is raised by her teacher, Mrs. Cassandra. Despite Mrs. Cassandra's warnings, Maya wants to explore the wide world and commits the unforgivable crime of leaving the hive. During her adventures, Maya, now in exile, befriends other insects and braves dangers with them. In the climax of the book, Maya is taken prisoner by hornets, the bees' sworn enemies. Prisoner of the hornets, Maya learns of a hornet plan to attack her native hive. Maya is faced with the decision to either return to hive and suffer her due punishment, saving the hive, or leaving the plan unannounced, saving herself but destroying the hive. After severe pondering, she makes the decision to return. In the hive, she announces the coming attack and is, totally unexpectedly, pardoned. The forewarned bees triumph over the hornet attack force. Maya, now a heroine of the hive, becomes a teacher like Mrs. Cassandra and shares her experiences and wisdom with the future generation. === Analysis of the book === {{More citations needed section|date=January 2018}} It has been suggested {{who|date=January 2018}} that the book may have carried a political message, analogous to [[Jean de La Fontaine]]'s or [[Ivan Krylov]]'s work. According to this view, Maya represents the ideal citizen, and the beehive represents a well-organised militarist society. It has also elements of nationalism and [[speciesism]]. Maya gets angry in two instances. First, a grasshopper fails to distinguish between [[bee]]s and [[wasp]]s. Maya's verbal response includes calling the wasps "a useless gang of bandits" [''Räubergeschlecht''] that have no "home or faith" [''Heimat und Glauben'']. Second, a [[fly]] calls Maya an idiot, which prompts Maya to shout that she's going to teach "respect for bees" and to threaten the fly with her stinger. The critic{{who|date=April 2020}} interprets this to mean that respect is based on the threat of violence. Collectivism versus individualism is also a theme. Maya's independence and departure from the beehive is seen as reproachable, but it is atoned by her warning of the hornets' attack. This show of loyalty restores her position in the society. In the hornet attack part of the story, the bees' will to defend the hive and the heroic deaths of bee officers are glorified, often in overtly [[militarism|militarist]] tones.{{cite web |first=Sulevi |last=Riukulehto |title=Lukiko Hitler Maija Mehiläistä? – Politiikka luuraa lastenkirjoissa. Tieteessä tapahtuu, 2001/7 |publisher= Tieteellisten seurain valtuuskunta. |url=http://www.tieteessatapahtuu.fi/017/riukulehto.htm}} In the post-WWII adaptations, the militarist element was toned down considerably, the hornets' role reduced, and the character of Willy, a lazy and quite un-warlike drone bee, was introduced (he does not appear in the novel). In the cartoon series, the briskly marching, but ridiculously incompetent [[ants|ant]] armies provide a parody of militarism. ==Main characters== * Maya – Bee. The series main protagonist. She loves freedom and living in the meadow by herself, unlike other bees who live in the hive. She is good, fair, happy and willing to help everybody. * Willy – Bee. Lazy, clumsy, and cowardly, sometimes a showoff, but generally good-natured – not featured in the original Bonsels story, but a major character in all adaptations other than the 1924 film. His relationship to Maya is depicted inconsistently: in most adaptations, he's her best friend, who is secretly in love with her, prone to jealousy when Maya's attentions turn to others. Often reluctantly dragged into adventures by Maya. * Flip (or Germany) – Grasshopper. A wise friend of Maya and Willy. Introduced first in the animated series. Whether he is meant to be identical with the unnamed grasshopper of the books is unclear. * Alexander (or Aleksander) – mouse. Intellectual, whose level of respect among the other creatures, and close friendship with Maya, often sends Willy into jealous rages. Appears only in the second season of the older animated series (1978). * Miss Cassandra – Bee, Teacher at the Bee-School. ==Films, anime and television== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size:85%;" |- ! rowspan=3| Crew !! colspan=2| Television series !! colspan=3| Feature films |- ! ''[[Maya the Honey Bee]]'' !! ''[[Maya the Bee (TV series)|Maya the Bee]]'' !! ''[[Maya the Bee (2014 film)|Maya the Bee Movie]]'' !! ''[[Maya the Bee: The Honey Games|Maya the Bee:
The Honey Games]]'' !! ''[[Maya the Bee: The Golden Orb]]'' |- ! 1975–1980 !! 2012–2017 !! 2014 !! 2018 !! TBA |- ! Noel Cleary, Fin Edquist and Alexs Stadermann || TBA |- ! Composer | [[Karel Svoboda (composer)|Karel Svoboda]] || Fabrice Aboulker || colspan=2| Ute Engelhardt || TBA |- ! ZDF
[[TF1]] || {{ubl|[[Screen Australia]]|[[Studio 100 Animation]]|[[Flying Bark Productions]]|[[ZDF]]|[[Screen NSW]]}} || {{ubl|Studio 100 Animation|[[Studio B Productions]]|Screen Australia}} || TBA |- ! U.S. Distribution | [[Nickelodeon]] ||[[Universal Kids|Sprout]]|| colspan="3" |[[Shout! Factory]] |- ! Released | {{Start date|1975|4|1}} – {{End date|1980|9|13}} || {{Start date|2012|9|5}} – {{End date|2017|8|23}} || {{start date|2015|3|8}} || {{start date|2018|5|1}} || TBA |} ===1924 film=== German director Wolfram Junghans made a 1924 silent version ("starring" real insects). It was restored in 2005 and released on DVD in 2012, with a new musical score.2012 DVD release by seeberfilm.com ===1975 anime=== Perhaps the most popular and widely known adaptation of the story is the Japanese anime {{nihongo|''[[Maya the Honey Bee]]''|みつばちマーヤの冒険|Mitsubachi Māya no Bōken|"The Adventures of Maya the Honeybee"}}. Originally aired on Japanese TV in 1975, the anime has been dubbed into 42 languages{{cite web |author=Filip Rožánek |url=http://blok.rozanek.cz/2007/02/09/patecni-youtubeni-vcelka-maja/ |title=Páteční youtubení: Včelka Mája | Blok Filipa Rožánka |publisher=Blok.rozanek.cz |date=February 13, 2007 |accessdate=April 30, 2012 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131217105119/http://blok.rozanek.cz/2007/02/09/patecni-youtubeni-vcelka-maja/ |archivedate=December 17, 2013 }} and screened on television in various territories, including China, South Korea, Australia, Austria, Germany, Ireland, the United States, South Africa, Peru, Portugal, Canada, Belgium, the Netherlands, United Kingdom, Ireland, France, Croatia, Chile, Israel, Italy, Greece, Albania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Slovenia, [[North Macedonia]], Bosnia and Herzegovina, Slovakia, Spain, Serbia, Finland, Poland, Ecuador, Hungary, Romania, Russia, Turkey, Lebanon (as ''Zena'') and Iran (as ''Nikoo'' (نیکو)). The Japanese TV series was preceded by [[Tokyo Kodomo Club]]'s [[musical play]] based on the short story, presented as ''Mitsubachi Māya'' ("Maya the Honeybee"), distributed on a [[LP album]]. The original theme was composed by [[Karel Svoboda (musician)|Karel Svoboda]] and sung by [[Karel Gott]] in the German, Czech and [[Slovak language|Slovak]] versions; [[Zbigniew Wodecki]] in the [[Polish language|Polish]] version.{{cite web|url=http://www.tyden.cz/rubriky/kultura/televize/popularni-vcelka-maja-se-vraci-ve-3d-karel-gott-nechybi_261429.html|title=Populární včelka Mája se vrací ve 3D. Karel Gott nechybí|date=February 15, 2013|publisher=[[Týden]]|language=Czech|accessdate=May 3, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.polskieradio.pl/7/3085/Artykul/985388,Jak-Zbigniew-Wodecki-zostal-Pszczolka-Maja|title=Jak Zbigniew Wodecki został Pszczółką Mają|date=November 24, 2013|publisher=[[Polskie Radio Program I]]|language=Polish|accessdate=May 3, 2014}} ===2012 TV series=== In 2012 [[Studio 100 Animation]] produced a 78-episode, [[Maya the Bee (TV series)|13-minute TV series]].{{cite web |title=Studio100 » Animation |website=Studio100.tv|accessdate=January 4, 2018 |url=http://www.studio100.tv/activities/animation/}} The series was rendered in [[3D animation|3D]] CGI animation.{{cite web|last1=Vlessing|first1=Etan|title=Canada's Thunderbird Films Steers 'Maya the Bee' into North America|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/canadas-thunderbird-films-steers-maya-321526|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 4, 2014}} A second 52 episode season aired in 2017. ===Film series=== A [[Maya the Bee (2014 film)|2014 film adaptation]] based upon the 2012 series was released.{{cite web|last1=Zahed|first1=Ramin|title=Flying Bark Launches ‘Maya the Bee’ Movie|url=http://www.animationmagazine.net/features/flying-bark-launches-maya-the-bee-movie/|work=Animation Magazine|accessdate=October 4, 2014}} In 2018, a sequel to the 2014 film, titled ''[[Maya the Bee: The Honey Games]]'', released on March 1, 2018 in Germany and May 1, 2018 in United States. ==Stage performances== ===Opera=== ''Maya the Bee'' also served as the basis for a children's opera written by the Croatian composer [[Bruno Bjelinski]] in 1963. In 2008 it was staged in [[Villach, Austria]] as part of their Carinthian Summer Music Festival.{{cite web|url=http://www.carinthischersommer.at/index.php?set_language=de&cccpage=english_information |title=Carinthischer Sommer|website=Carinthischersommer.at |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} This performance was distinguished by having the "bees" played by children and not professional opera singers as it is usually the case.{{cite web|url=http://www.carinthischersommer.at/index.php?set_language=de&cccpage=programm_juli_detail&set_z_veranstaltungen=12 |title=Carinthischer Sommer |website=Carinthischersommer.at |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} ===Puppet musical=== Singer-songwriter [[Nancy Harrow]] created a jazz-musical version of the story, called ''The Adventures of Maya the Bee'', that featured puppets by Zofia Czechlewska. Harrow's adaptation was produced in New York City by The Culture Project in 2000,{{cite web|url=http://www.sagecraft.com/puppetry/reviews/Maya.html |title=A review of Maya the Bee |website=Sagecraft.com |accessdate=September 13, 2016}} and was revived in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.nancyharrow.com/maya.php |title=The Culture Project presents The Adventures of Maya the Bee |website=Nancyharrow.com |accessdate=September 13, 2016}} ===Musical=== On October 10, 2016, Belgian company Studio 100 created a Flemish stage musical called "Maya en de Pollenbollen" based on the 2012 series that has the people dressed in costumes for the characters from the show. The show contains songs made by Studio 100 with a few news songs created exclusively for the show. The musical centers around Maya alongside Flip and Beatrice celebrating Willy's birthday. ==Video games== * '''Maya the Bee & Her Friends''' ([[Game Boy Color]] – 1999) Developed by Crawfish, published by [[Acclaim Games|Acclaim]]. Originally developed as a ''[[South Park]]'' themed game before being reskinned. * '''Maya the Bee – Garden Adventures''' ([[Game Boy Color]] – 2000)[http://www.keengames.com/products/former/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures.html Neon Studios Maya the Bee] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080323213345/http://www.keengames.com/products/former/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures/maya_the_bee___garden_adventures.html |date=March 23, 2008 }} Developed by [[Neon Studios]], published by Acclaim. * '''Maya the Bee and Friends''' ([[mobile phone|mobile]] – 2006)[http://www.kiloo.com/brand_game_mayathebee.html Kiloo page] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080419060016/http://www.kiloo.com/brand_game_mayathebee.html |date=April 19, 2008 }} Developed by [[Kiloo]] and co-published by Plan-B Media. * '''Maya the Bee: The Great Adventure''' ([[Game Boy Advance]] – 2002){{cite web|url=http://shinen.com/games/game.php3?maya |title=Shin'en Maya the Bee |publisher=Shinen.com |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} Developed by [[Shin'en Multimedia]], published by Acclaim. * '''Maya the Bee: Sweet Gold''' ([[Game Boy Advance]] – 2005){{cite web|url=http://shinen.com/games/game.php3?maya2 |title=Shin'en Maya the Bee 2 |publisher=Shinen.com |date=March 18, 2005 |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} Developed by Shin'en Multimedia, published by [[Midway Games|Midway]]. * '''The Bee Game''' (Game Boy Advance,{{cite web|url=http://www.independent-arts-software.de/index.php?id=39&L=1 |title=tBG GBA page |publisher=Independent-arts-software.de |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} [[Nintendo DS]]{{cite web|url=http://www.independent-arts-software.de/index.php?id=35&L=1 |title=tBG DS page |publisher=Independent-arts-software.de |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} – 2007){{cite web|url=http://mayabeegame.com/ |title=Midway the Bee Game page |publisher=Mayabeegame.com |accessdate=April 30, 2012}} The Bee Game is an adventure video game released for Nintendo DS and Game Boy Advance, developed by German studio Independent Arts Software. The game lets players experience the adventures of Maya the Bee and her friend Willie as they search for their friends, lost from a strong storm that has blown through Corn Poppy Meadow.{{cite web |last=Adams |first=Chris |date=November 6, 2007 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2007/11/06/the-bee-game-review |title=The Bee Game Review (NDS) |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=April 17, 2017}} * '''Maya''' (Nintendo DS – 2013) Developed by Studio 100, published by Bandai Namco Games Europe. * '''Maya the Bee: The Nutty Race''' (iOS and Android – 2019) [[Mobile game|Mobile racing game]]. Developed by Midnight Pigeon in cooperation with Studio 100. ==Merchandising== Many companies contributed worldwide to the success of the character by producing and selling merchandising. Most of them were drawn between 1976 and 1986 by the French licensed characters specialist André Roche.{{cite web|url=http://kinder-characters-creator.illustration.de|title=- Holzwickeder Sport Club|website=kinder-characters-creator.illustration.de|accessdate=January 3, 2018|archive-url=https://archive.today/20120709112447/http://kinder-characters-creator.illustration.de/|archive-date=July 9, 2012|url-status=dead}} His works have included motifs for textiles, porcelain, books, comics and games, including a campaign for [[Kinder Surprise]] Eggs. == See also == * ''[[Maya the Honey Bee]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official|http://www.diebienemaja-film.de/}} {{in lang|de}} *The Finnish Film Archive (November 23, 2005). [https://web.archive.org/web/20060630092524/http://www.sea.fi/esitykset/syksy2005/news_maijam.html "Esitykset: Maija Mehiläinen"] (in Finnish). Retrieved January 20, 2006. *[http://www.cinefest.de/e/pro_filme.php cinefest – International Festival of German Film Heritage]. Retrieved January 20, 2006. *[https://www.seeberfilm.com/shop/biene-maja-dvd/ Silent film version on DVD with english subtitles].
